net.markenwerk.utils.json.parser

Class StringJsonSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.markenwerk.utils.json.parser.StringJsonSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, JsonSource

    public final class StringJsonSource
extends Object
implements JsonSource
    A StringJsonSource is a JsonSource that is backed by a given String.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Torsten Krause (tk at markenwerk dot net)

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface net.markenwerk.utils.json.parser.JsonSource

      Returns the column that corresponds to the current position of this JsonSource in the character sequence, as if the character source was a regular file.

      Returns some of the characters havn't been consumed yet, beginning with the next character to be consumed, if already available, or an empty String otherwise.

      Returns the line that corresponds to the current position of this JsonSource in the character sequence, as if the character source was a regular file.

        Ensures that a given minimum of characters is available to be consumed.
        Specified by:
        makeAvailable in interface JsonSource
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • peekCharacter

        public char peekCharacter(int offset)
        Description copied from interface: JsonSource
        Returns a future character in the character sequence, without consuming it.

        Callers must ensure, that the desired amount of characters is available.

        Specified by:
        peekCharacter in interface JsonSource
        Parameters:
        offset - The amount of characters to look ahead. Must be non-negative.
        Returns:
        The future character in the character sequence.

                             int length)
        Description copied from interface: JsonSource
        Consumes and appends the next characters in the character sequence to the given StringBuilder.

        Callers must ensure, that the desired amount of characters is available.

        Specified by:
        appendNextString in interface JsonSource
        Parameters:
        builder - The string builder to add the characters to. Must be non-negative.
        length - The amount of characters to be consumed.

      • getPast

        public String getPast(int maximum)
        Description copied from interface: JsonSource
        Returns some of the characters that already have been consumed, ending with the last consumed character, if still available, or an empty String otherwise.
        Specified by:
        getPast in interface JsonSource
        Parameters:
        maximum - The maximum amount of characters. Must be non-negative.
        Returns:

      • getFuture

        public String getFuture(int maximum)
        Description copied from interface: JsonSource

        Returns:

      • getLine

        public int getLine()
        Description copied from interface: JsonSource
        Returns the line that corresponds to the current position of this JsonSource in the character sequence, as if the character source was a regular file.

        The line is equal to the number of consumed \n-characters + 1.

        Specified by:
        getLine in interface JsonSource
        Returns:
        The line.

      • getColumn

        public int getColumn()
        Description copied from interface: JsonSource
        Returns the column that corresponds to the current position of this JsonSource in the character sequence, as if the character source was a regular file.

        The column is equal to the number of consumed characters + 1 in the current line.

        Specified by:
        getColumn in interface JsonSource
        Returns:
        The line.
